Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: You stand at a four-way intersection. Scanning about, you see that every direction appears to be exactly the same as all the other directions. The wide paths are cast in perpetual shadow as thorn bushes tower above, as far as the eye can see. The razor-sharp thorns are coated in a deadly venom and you can see that to touch them even slightly would be fatal, making passage through them virtually impossible. A large sign catches your attention!

ExtraDescription.Description: ***************************************************** **********************BEWARE************************* ***************************************************** Do not proceed unless you are brave of heart! If you are, then venture forth and seek your destiny! If you are not, proceed south!

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: You stare about you in dismay, you feel like you are standing in the exact place you just left. Everything looks exactly the same. Wondering how this could be, you scan about hoping to see something that distinguishes itself from everything else. Nothing pops out at you and you begin to wonder if you will ever find the exit or, a more likely possibility, be lost in here forever.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: Standing perfectly centered in the middle of the interesction is a tall barrel, finely crafted in washed oak. Upon closer inspection you notice that it is full of crisp, cool rainwater. A silver dipper is hooked to the rim for any who wish to take a drink. You wonder what divine hand reached down and put this generous reprieve in such an unfriendly place.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: All about, the sounds of laugther and talk can be heard. This is quite surprising as the thorn bushes are extremely dense and should be blocking the surrounding sounds. You look about to see where the sounds are coming from and see an occasional scuff mark marring the lawn covered path. Aside from these few marks, the grass is perfectly tended by someone who obviously takes great pride in his work.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: You are taken by surprise when you notice and exquisitely sculpted flower nestled amonst the poisonous thorns. The petals range in colors from the deepest purples to the palest yellows. You wonder how such a flower could grow in such a deadly place. Then you take a second look at it. Maybe, at long last, you have found something to help you figure out where you are.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: You begin to feel dizzy as you look about. Nothing changes. Everything looks the same. You begin to wonder if you are going crazy. You consider asking for directions, but no one looks very friendly. Everyone is too busy doing other things to give you the time of day, let alone tell you how to leave seemingly exitless maze. You wonder which direction you should go next, of if you should even bother to continue on.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: Clustered in a tight circle near the edge of the thorn bushes, similar to a faerie ring, grows a patch of brilliantly colored blue mushrooms. Dotted in lighter colored blue spots, they look very tempting. You consider tasting one, but wonder if they too, like the thorns they grow near, are poisonous, especially as they seem so out of place in this perfectly manicured labyrinth.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: An unnatural green light shines down over the hedges, casting grotesque shadows along the pathway. You look about trying to see where it is coming from, but like everything else in this maze, you can't find anything. You glance more closely at the shadows and notice that the thorns create the appearance of rows of razor-sharp teeth readying to tear your flesh to pieces. Although you know this is an illusion, you hurry onward.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: Completely enshrouding the carpeted pathways, a dark, swirling mist hovers just above the ground here. You step carefully into it and shudder as it engulfs your lower body. It wraps around you, caressing your body with its darkness. You can't quite be sure, but it almost feels alive. You hurry through it, not quite caring which direction you go, just anywhere away from it, even if that means becoming more lost.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: Lost and without hope of finding your way out, you stand in the middle of the intersection trying to figure out which way you should go next. You face north, east, south, then west, scratching your head in utter bewilderment. You step toward the north, then change your mind and start heading south. You stop again and mutter irritably to yourself. Which way to go?

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: Clustered in a tight circle near the edge of the thorn bushes, similar to a faerie ring, grows a patch of brilliantly colored blue mushrooms. Dotted in lighter colored blue spots, they look very tempting. You consider tasting one, but wonder if they too, like the thorns they grow near, are poisonous, especially as they seem so out of place in this perfectly manicured labyrinth.

Room.Name: Dead End
Room.Description: You have reached a dead end. There is nowhere to go but east.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: Lost and without hope of finding your way out, you stand in the middle of the intersection trying to figure out which way you should go next. You face north, east, south, then west, scratching your head in utter bewilderment. You step toward the north, then change your mind and start heading south. You stop again and mutter irritably to yourself. Which way to go?

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: You stand at a four-way intersection. Scanning about, you see that every direction appears to be exactly the same as all the other directions. The wide paths are cast in perpetual shadow as thorn bushes tower above, as far as the eye can see. The razor-sharp thorns are coated in a deadly venom and you can see that to touch them even slightly would be fatal, making passage through them virtually impossible.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: You stare about you in dismay, you feel like you are standing in the exact place you just left. Everything looks exactly the same. Wondering how this could be, you scan about hoping to see something that distinguishes itself from everything else. Nothing pops out at you and you begin to wonder if you will ever find the exit or, a more likely possibility, be lost in here forever.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: Completely enshrouding the carpeted pathways, a dark, swirling mist hovers just above the ground here. You step carefully into it and shudder as it engulfs your lower body. It wraps around you, caressing your body with its darkness. You can't quite be sure, but it almost feels alive. You hurry through it, not quite caring which direction you go, just anywhere away from it, even if that means becoming more lost.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: Lost and without hope of finding your way out, you stand in the middle of the intersection trying to figure out which way you should go next. You face north, east, south, then west, scratching your head in utter bewilderment. You step toward the north, then change your mind and start heading south. You stop again and mutter irritably to yourself. Which way to go?

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: You stand at a four-way intersection. Scanning about, you see that every direction appears to be exactly the same as all the other directions. The wide paths are cast in perpetual shadow as thorn bushes tower above, as far as the eye can see. The razor-sharp thorns are coated in a deadly venom and you can see that to touch them even slightly would be fatal, making passage through them virtually impossible.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: You stare about you in dismay, you feel like you are standing in the exact place you just left. Everything looks exactly the same. Wondering how this could be, you scan about hoping to see something that distinguishes itself from everything else. Nothing pops out at you and you begin to wonder if you will ever find the exit or, a more likely possibility, be lost in here forever.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: Standing perfectly centered in the middle of the interesction is a tall barrel, finely crafted in washed oak. Upon closer inspection you notice that it is full of crisp, cool rainwater. A silver dipper is hooked to the rim for any who wish to take a drink. You wonder what divine hand reached down and put this generous reprieve in such an unfriendly place.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: All about, the sounds of laugther and talk can be heard. This is quite surprising as the thorn bushes are extremely dense and should be blocking the surrounding sounds. You look about to see where the sounds are coming from and see an occasional scuff mark marring the lawn covered path. Aside from these few marks, the grass is perfectly tended by someone who obviously takes great pride in his work.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: You are taken by surprise when you notice and exquisitely sculpted flower nestled amonst the poisonous thorns. The petals range in colors from the deepest purples to the palest yellows. You wonder how such a flower could grow in such a deadly place. Then you take a second look at it. Maybe, at long last, you have found something to help you figure out where you are.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: You begin to feel dizzy as you look about. Nothing changes. Everything looks the same. You begin to wonder if you are going crazy. You consider asking for directions, but no one looks very friendly. Everyone is too busy doing other things to give you the time of day, let alone tell you how to leave seemingly exitless maze. You wonder which direction you should go next, of if you should even bother to continue on.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: Clustered in a tight circle near the edge of the thorn bushes, similar to a faerie ring, grows a patch of brilliantly colored blue mushrooms. Dotted in lighter colored blue spots, they look very tempting. You consider tasting one, but wonder if they too, like the thorns they grow near, are poisonous, especially as they seem so out of place in this perfectly manicured labyrinth.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: An unnatural green light shines down over the hedges, casting grotesque shadows along the pathway. You look about trying to see where it is coming from, but like everything else in this maze, you can't find anything. You glance more closely at the shadows and notice that the thorns create the appearance of rows of razor-sharp teeth readying to tear your flesh to pieces. Although you know this is an illusion, you hurry onward.

Room.Name: The Cell
Room.Description: The Commander's favorite place, this cell is used for any foolish enough to cross his path. Completely austure, not even a chair graces the room. The walls, floor and ceiling are painted the dullest of greys, and the doors, facing south, east and west have no latch of any kind. Although they stand open when not in use, for any who wish to pass through, they work on a spring, timing mechanism when the Commander has locked someone in. If he had to let them out himself, they would find themselves rotting in there permanently.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: You begin to feel dizzy as you look about. Nothing changes. Everything looks the same. You begin to wonder if you are going crazy. You consider asking for directions, but no one looks very friendly. Everyone is too busy doing other things to give you the time of day, let alone tell you how to leave seemingly exitless maze. You wonder which direction you should go next, of if you should even bother to continue on.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: Clustered in a tight circle near the edge of the thorn bushes, similar to a faerie ring, grows a patch of brilliantly colored blue mushrooms. Dotted in lighter colored blue spots, they look very tempting. You consider tasting one, but wonder if they too, like the thorns they grow near, are poisonous, especially as they seem so out of place in this perfectly manicured labyrinth.

Upon closer inspection you notice that it is full of crisp, cool rainwater. A silver dipper is hooked to the rim for any who wish to take a drink. You wonder what divine hand reached down and put this generous reprieve in such an unfriendly place.

Room.Name: A Four-Way Junction
Room.Description: All about, the sounds of laugther and talk can be heard. This is quite surprising as the thorn bushes are extremely dense and should be blocking the surrounding sounds. You look about to see where the sounds are coming from and see an occasional scuff mark marring the lawn covered path. Aside from these few marks, the grass is perfectly tended by someone who obviously takes great pride in his work.

NPC.name: minotaur commander
NPC.description: Although he enjoys his high station in life and has made it to the top of his career, he hates his post and resents all who work for him. Self pity has made him cruel and those assigned to him avoid him whenever possible. He is not above using his fists to put his underlings in their place.
NPC.longDescription: The minotaur commander orders you to be on your way.

NPC.name: minotaur guard
NPC.description: He sighs pitingly at himself, wondering what folly he committed to get himself such a degrading job. He bucks up when he sees you and scans about, making sure no would-be lovers are using the maze for any purpose other than to meet their lifemate.
NPC.longDescription: A minotaur guard warns you to get on your way.

NPC.name: minotaur father
NPC.description: He loves his daughters, but wishes they would just find husbands, get married and start producing grand-children for him to play with. But he'll be damned if he'll let them take lovers.
NPC.longDescription: A minotaur father eyes you up and down.

NPC.name: minotaur mother
NPC.description: She is already busy making plans for their weddings. She wants everything to be perfect so she'll have something to talk about with her friends when they get together. She doesn't care how they pay for the weddings, just so long as they are bigger and better than everyone elses.

NPC.name: minotaur man
NPC.description: He barely takes notice of you, as he is too busy trying to catch the eye of the lovely maidens wandering about. Against their father's hopes, he has no intention of taking a bride until he is much older. A mistress or two is what he seeks and he's determined to arrage it.
NPC.longDescription: A minotaur man tips his head politely as you pass.

NPC.name: minotaur maiden
NPC.description: She giggles flirtatiously as she was taught. She has come in search of a husband and will do whatever it takes to get one, She's no fool, she knows it won't be easy changing his mind from wanting a just a bed partner to a wife, but when she wants something, she gets it, or else...
NPC.longDescription: A minotaur maiden smiles coquettishely at you.

NPC.name: minotaur lad
NPC.description: He finds all this mushiness extremely boring. To stir up some fun he has snuck away from his mother to start up a game of hide-and-seek. He wass hiding and she was supposed to seek him out. But now he is the seeker as his pet got loose and he must find him before his father finds out.
NPC.longDescription: A minotaur lad searches for his misplaced pet.

NPC.name: minotaur mongrel
NPC.description: It is a huge, hulking mongrel, one of the ugliest creatures you have ever seen. Two sets of teeth, as long and thick as your fingers, cause its jaws, dripping with saliva, to stay ajar. It's eye, a mixture of yellow and red stare warningly at you.
NPC.longDescription: A minotaur mongrel sniffs menacingly at you.
NPC.flags: NPC Scavenger StayArea AreaAttack AssistRace AssistVnum

NPC.name: minotaur janitor
NPC.description: He looks about in disgust, wondering whatever could have made him think being a janitor would be easy around such utter slobs. He picks up another peice of litter and curses any in hearing distance. No one pays him a bit of attention.
NPC.longDescription: A minotaur janitor mutters as he picks up another piece of trash.

NPC.name: minotaur gardener
NPC.description: She loves her job and it shows in the beautifull grooming throughout the maze. She carefully clips a piece of hedge, picks it up with a strange metallic device and drops it in a specially designed metallic, mesh sack.
NPC.longDescription: A minotaur gardener whistles happily to himself as he trims the hedges.

NPC.name: minotaur girl
NPC.description: She is lost and can't find her mother. Her small frame shakes violently from her sobbing. She tries to gain control of herself, looks around for a familiar face, finds none and starts crying again. She clasps her hands around her knees and start rocking back and forth.
NPC.longDescription: A minotaur girl sobs quietly to herself.

Item.Name: water barrel
Item.LongDescription: A barrel rests in the middle of the path, full of rain water.

Item.Name: blue mushroom
Item.LongDescription: A large, blue mushroom disturbs the perfectly manicured grass.

Item.Name: chain-link collar
Item.LongDescription: A chain-link collar glints dully on the ground.

Item.Name: opalescent ball
Item.LongDescription: A fist sized ball glitters with an opalescent sheen.

Item.Name: jade bracelet
Item.LongDescription: A green bracelet lies neglected on the floor.

Item.Name: studded cuff links
Item.LongDescription: A pair of studded cuff links lays discarded in a corner.

Item.Name: mother's ring
Item.LongDescription: A gold studded ring lies fogotten on the ground.

Item.Name: wool cloak
Item.LongDescription: A pile of wool lays balled up in a corner.

Item.Name: steel-toed boots
Item.LongDescription: A pair of steel-toed boots is covered in dust.

Item.Name: gleaming belt buckle
Item.LongDescription: An oddly shaped piece of iron reflects the light.

Item.Name: watchman's cudgel
Item.LongDescription: A thick club lays menacingly in the dirt.

Item.Name: minotaur commander's combat uniform
Item.LongDescription: A dashing uniform lays untouched on the floor.

Item.Name: minotaur commander's combat crest
Item.LongDescription: A militant helm with a leaders insignia rests on the ground.

Item.Name: minotaur commander's combat sollerets
Item.LongDescription: A mass of material lays in a forgotten heap.

Item.Name: minotaur commander's combat gloves
Item.LongDescription: A pair of gauntlets lies in a crumpled heap.

Item.Name: key
Item.LongDescription: A tiny black key lays hidden in the dirt.

Item.Name: janitor's stick
Item.LongDescription: A thin piece of wood with a sharp, pointed end lies in the grass.

Item.Name: belt sack
Item.LongDescription: A metalic, mesh sack lies here.

Item.Name: thin gold necklace
Item.LongDescription: A thin gold necklace glints brightly in the dirt.

Item.Name: thin gold bracelet
Item.LongDescription: A thin gold bracelet lies neglected in the dirt.

Item.Name: thin gold ring
Item.LongDescription: A thin gold ring lies fogotten in the dirt.
